case_title: MUHAMMAD AND OTHERS vs THB STATE
complaint_summary: Fateh Muhammad, father of deceased Muhammad Tufail, filed a revision petition challenging the discharge of accused under Section 209 CrPC by Magistrate Minchinabad.
investigation_summary: Police charged petitioners under Sections 302, 148/149 PPC following an incident on 25-5-1965. Magistrate discharged accused citing lack of prima facie evidence.
judgment_summary: The impugned judgment by Syed Sajjad Ali Shah was declared void due to lack of jurisdiction. Case remitted to Sessions Judge Bahawalnagar for fresh disposal.
legal_arguments: Jurisdiction of Sessions Judge after transfer
Authority to transfer cases between divisions
Applicability of Section 9 CrPC for jurisdiction extension
key_issues: Legality of case transfer between divisions

legal_terms.functus officio: A legal term indicating that an officer or authority has exhausted its mandate.

words_and_phrases.prima facie: At first glance; based on initial impression.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around jurisdictional issues following the transfer of a Sessions Judge. The impugned judgment was quashed due to lack of lawful authority, and the case was remitted for fresh disposal by the competent Sessions Judge.
